title: ALPR audit

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR audit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

For the Flock system operated by Metro Transit and by any other Bi-State entities, please list the entity operating Flock devices, and:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

title: FDEM Alligator Alcatraz attorney contact emails

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FDEM Alligator Alcatraz attorney contact emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All emails to or from the address "legal@privacy6.com" between July 2, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

An FDEM spokesperson provided the above email address in a July 15 Miami Herald story for attorney correspondence and scheduling at the "Alligator Alcatraz" detention center : https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/immigration/article310625140.html

Under Fla. Stat. § 119.0701(1)(a), private contractors are subject to public record law when they contract with public agencies and are acting on behalf of the public agency in providing those services.  

Please also note that when responsive records contain exempt material, the custodian must redact the applicable portions and release the rest of the records. “A person who has custody of a public record who asserts that an exemption applies to a part of such record shall redact that portion of the record to which an exemption has been asserted and validly applies, and such person shall produce the remainder of such record for inspection and copying.” Fla. Stat. § 119.07(1)(d) (2020)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

Under the Florida Sunshine Law (Chapter 119, Florida Statutes), I respectfully request the following records:

All body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage and traffic camera video related to the June 2, 2021, vehicle crash and arrest of Jasmine Christine Speach (DOB: 07/20/1998) at or near the intersection of US Highway 19 and Main Street, New Port Richey, FL 34652.

The incident is documented under agency report number 21-01874. The arresting or investigating agency may include the New Port Richey Police Department and/or Pasco County Sheriff's Office.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera recordings from officers on scene

All dash camera footage from responding patrol vehicles

Traffic camera footage, if applicable

If any portion of these materials is exempt, I request that all non-exempt portions be released and any redactions be justified with specific statutory exemptions.

I am requesting these records for non-commercial, journalistic purposes. I would prefer to receive the responsive materials in digital format via email or a downloadable link. Please inform me of any potential costs before fulfilling the request.

Sincerely,

title: Request for Bodycam & Dashcam Footage – Arrest of Emekwanem Biosah (June 26, 2025, Harris County, TX)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Request for Bodycam & Dashcam Footage – Arrest of Emekwanem Biosah (June 26, 2025, Harris County, TX)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, I hereby request the following records:

Request:
I respectfully request copies of all body-worn camera (BWC) and dash camera footage related to the arrest of Emekwanem Ogugua Biosah (DOB: 03/29/1990) on or about June 26, 2025, at approximately 4:55 PM in Harris County, Texas.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

All body-worn camera video captured by officers involved in the arrest or pursuit of Mr. Biosah, including any footage captured by Officer C. Offord or other personnel involved.

Any dash cam footage from marked patrol vehicles participating in the pursuit or stop.

Footage of the vehicle operation, pursuit, signal to stop, and the immediate aftermath of the arrest.

As described in D.A. Log Number 3167769 (Cause No. 257089201010 002, Harris County Criminal Court at Law No. 3), Mr. Biosah was charged with Fleeing or Attempting to Elude a Police Officer, following a pursuit initiated with emergency lights by Officer C. Offord in a marked vehicle.

This request is being made for non-commercial, journalistic, and public interest purposes.

If there are any fees, please inform me in advance. I prefer to receive the responsive records in digital format (via email or secure download). If necessary, please redact any exempt portions rather than withholding entire records.

I request a response within the 10 business days allowed under Texas law.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Planning.

title: Energy and Innovation Summit

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Energy and Innovation Summit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The Pennsylvania Energy and Innovation Summit took place July 15, 2025 at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) in Pittsburgh, PA. Media reporting has indicated that the Secret Service was involved in discussions about a fence being painted on the CMU campus: https://triblive.com/local/fence-fight-cmu-orders-students-anti-trump-message-painted-over-ahead-of-presidents-visit/

I request the following information:

1) Email communications containing any of the terms (not case sensitive) "fence", "paint", "repaint", "re-paint", "no rapists on our campus", "protest the summit", or "stop the summit" sent to or from an email address ending in @cmu.edu, @andrew.cmu.edu, or any other subdomain of cmu.edu between July 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

2) All communications (including emails, calendar invites, meeting notes, and other correspondence) with Farnam Jahanian (including but not limited to farnam@cmu.edu, farnam@andrew.cmu.edu, or president@andrew.cmu.edu), Gina Casalegno (gina.casalegno@cmu.edu or ginac@andrew.cmu.edu), and Daryl Weinert (dweinert@cmu.edu or dweinert@andrew.cmu.edu) between June 1, 2025 and July 16, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Weinshel

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I request all FBI records that reasonably describe references to Virginia Louise Giuffre (née Roberts), DOB: August 9, 1983 – DOD: April 25, 2025, in connection with the investigations of Jeffrey Edward Epstein (DOB: January 20, 1953 – DOD: August 10, 2019). This includes, but is not limited to:

Victim/witness statements, interviews, or FBI 302 summaries involving Giuffre

Internal memoranda, emails, or reports referencing Giuffre’s allegations

Communications between the FBI and other federal or state agencies referencing her

Any other documents discussing her death in relation to the Epstein or Maxwell investigations

Given Ms. Giuffre’s passing, Exemptions 6 and 7(C) do not apply. I request that all responsive records be provided electronically. Should the fees exceed $25, please notify me in advance.

Thank you. I expect a response within 20 business days as required by law.

Sincerely,
Kaycie Crossley

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kaycie Crossley

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The library's most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with library vendor Lexis Nexis relating to the licensing of the library database Nexis Uni; and

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent in the library's or university's possession; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession.

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of the library database Nexis Uni in the library's or university's possession.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

mo

title: Request to FBI for 2022 budget report for Office of Public Affairs

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to FBI for 2022 budget report for Office of Public Affairs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The 2022 annual budget report for the Office of Public Affairs of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." title: State Dept support for 2015 documentary "American Caravan"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: State Dept support for 2015 documentary "American Caravan"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the US Department of State and the production of the 2015 documentary film "American Caravan," directed by Jerome Gary and Shawn David Thompson. Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the State Dept. and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "American Caravan," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Request to State Department for all documents pertaining to MENA Media Fund

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to State Department for all documents pertaining to MENA Media Fund
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All US Department of State documents subject to FOIA pertaining to the MENA Media Fund. 

According to online biographies of filmmaker and producer Jerome Gary, he is the "Chairman" of the MENA Media Fund, "which in association with the US Department of State, invests in media in the Middle East and North Africa."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All Advisories, Suspicious Activity Reports, Tips, Intelligence Briefs, Intel Reports, Leads Information or Data, Maps, Bulletins, BOLOs, and/or Joint Bulletins from 1 June 2025 to the date this request is processed including the search term "epstein".

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

title: Esptein

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Esptein
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any internal or external communications -- including emails, text messages, and memoranda -- mentioning 
the key work "epstein" between June 1 2025 and the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

This FOI request is being filed in pursuit of a time-sensitive news story. Therefore, I ask that my request is expedited. When completing this request, please prioritize whichever records would take the least amount of time to be located and released. I would like these records in electronic format, sent via email or other digital method, and again, please release documents on a rolling basis, as they become available.

If you determine that any of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, I ask you to note whether the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information.

Also, I am a member of the news media as a freelance reporter. As such, the requested documents are in the public interest and not being made for commercial purposes. Therefore, I ask that all fees are waived in the processing of my request. If fees associated with this request will be in excess of $25, kindly notify me in advance of fulfilling this request. As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is timely, I would appreciate your communicating with me if you have questions regarding this request.

Thanks again, and I look forward to your reply within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires and an even more prompt reply if you can make a determination without having to review the records in question.

-Daniel Boguslaw

Code Ann. § 25-61-5(1)(b), MDOC is providing notice that a response is anticipated in fourteen (14) days due to a significantly heavy workload. The reference number R000944-071625 for tracking purposes: Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

I am seeking the employee file for an emplyee believed to be no longer employed with mdoc. The employee is Kristen Reichert. The emplyee worked at Marshall County Correctional Facility Prison in Holly Springs, Mississippi. At a minimum I am seeking dates of employment and reason for termination including any investigative materials surrounding her termination.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

William Morris

title: Prevented Mass Violence - Case Material from 2018 Everett, WA Arrest

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Prevented Mass Violence - Case Material from 2018 Everett, WA Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Police report, supplements, investigative case file, run notes, and CAD notes relating to the arrest of Joshua Alexander O'Connor in February of 2018. 
2) Photos/scans of any notebooks, manifestos, or documents produced by the arrested party.
3) Any remaining bodycam footage or media relating to the search of the arrested party's property.

The requested material will be used as part of a research effort on cases where incidents of mass violence were prevented by family and law enforcement. Thank you for your assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A

title: BAAQMD ALPR Review

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: BAAQMD ALPR Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents relating to usage of Automated License Plate Recognition (ALPR) technology by the Bay Area Air Quality Management District, including static and vehicle-based cameras. This includes:

1) NDAs, MSAs, SOWs, and contracts relating to the purchase and maintenance of ALPR systems owned/operated by the Bay Area Air Quality Management District
2) ALPR policies, procedures, guides, and training materials 
3)  The names of agencies and organizations with which the BAAQMD shared ALPR data in 2025
4) All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods June 1st, 2024 until the date of processing this request (An audit log of ALPR queries, time/date, identity/role, agency, and type of data accessed will suffice). If your agency has a retention period shorter than 1 year, please provide whatever data is available based on your retention period. 
5) Any MOU or data sharing agreement which allows BAAQMD ALPR records to be shared or queried by non-BAAQMD personnel.
6) Any search warrants, subpoenas, or court orders BAAQMD has received for ALPR data. 

I appreciate your assistance. I'd be happy to chat and provide additional context to aid you in your search.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A

communications.subject: San Francisco Police Public Records Request :: P215612-071625
communications.communication:
Dear Shawn A: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the San Francisco Police Department ("SFPD"). 
 
The San Francisco Police Department ("SFPD") received your request, dated July 16, 2025 and given the reference number P215612-071625 for tracking purposes. 
 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking the following documents relating to LexisNexis and their products Accurint and Accurint® Public Safety Marketplace:
1) NDAs, MOUs, SOWs, MSAs, and any active contracting documents between your agency and LexisNexis
2) Any/all instructional materials or presentations relating to Accurint
3) Accurint use policies and standard operating procedures

Please also search for agreements with associated LexisNexis entities: "LexisNexis Risk Solutions" or "RELX"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn A

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fsan-francisco-police-department-367%252Faccurint-lexisnexis-contracting-documents-san-francisco-police-department-189685%252F%253Femail%253Dsanfranciscopd%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAIhlqz_6HzFpF9QbtVNXCgHbA%3A1ucEmW%3A_Qp7PK10o-LiB3MTW-GPMO9qJ1mKm4qZj1CdcFBZvA4 
 
Your request is being forwarded to the appropriate department(s) for processing and you will be notified once the request is complete. 
 
You can monitor request progress at the link below.  Thank you for using the San Francisco Public Records Center. 
 
 
San Francisco Police Department
